instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Backlight
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board severe liquid damaged!

Missing tracks from <SIGNAL>LCDBKL_DISABLE</SIGNAL>

Had to drill a hole on the board cause <SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKL_PWR</SIGNAL> was also missing

<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> 2.89v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKL_PWR</SIGNAL> 12.45v

Still no backlight!

Replace <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Backlight
threads.message: Check continuity on feedback line from ball A5 to <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Backlight
threads.message: continuity OK from a5 to pin2 on <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Backlight
threads.message: FB line seems ok, I'll try to replace <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>

threads.message: <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> present? PRAM reset done? Got image without backlight?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Backlight
threads.message: <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> replaced and all resistors around it ok? LCD must be connected when measuring voltages. What is exact voltage on PWM?

threads.message: Voltage on pins 2,4,6 and 7 from J9000

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Backlight
threads.message:
"Voltage on pins 2,4,6 and 7 from J9000" There is 3V on L9008 so LCD is recognized.

Hanging on a grey screen like that could be anything. Disconnected everything and connect a known good LCD, see if question mark comes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Backlight
threads.message:
2 - 3,18v
4 - 3,22v
6 - 3,21v
7 - 3,21v

when doing the measures, questiom mark appeared, next reboot, didnt show again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Backlight
threads.message:
replaced <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and comonents on pin 2 line, its working! doing further tests!

Tks!
